member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcessDotNetExt.CreateProcess.withToolType``1(Fake.DotNet.ToolType,Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary: Ensures the command is run with dotnet or with framework/mono as appropriate.

example.code: Command.RawCommand("tool", Arguments.OfArgs ["arg1"; "arg2"]) |> CreateProcess.fromCommand |> CreateProcess.withToolType toolType // prepare to execute tool, mono tool, or dotnet localtool. |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: T:Fake.Core.CreateProcessDotNetExt
member.summary: Some extensions for the CreateProcess module, opened automatically (use add open Fake.Core)

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.ToolType.GlobalTool
member.summary: The application is a global dotnet cli tool, does not prefix anything, expects ToolPath to be the platform dependent path to the application.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.ToolType.SelfContainedDeployment
member.summary: The application is a self contained application, does not prefix anything, expects ToolPath to be the platform dependent path to the application.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.ToolType.FrameworkDependentDeployment
member.summary: The application is a framework dependent application, prefixes the app with <c>dotnet</c> and allows ToolPath to be the path to the dll.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.ToolType.FullFramework
member.summary: The application is a pre .NET 5 full framework application, ToolPath is combined with <c>CreateProcess.withFramework</c>. Which prefixes the command with <c>mono</c> on non-windows platforms

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.ToolType
member.summary: Describes which kind of application ToolPath references

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNetLocalTool.ToolCommandName
member.summary: The command name of the tool (the first argument of 'dotnet'). For example `"fake"` for `dotnet fake`. By default we usually fallback to the executable name of ToolPath without file extension.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNetLocalTool.Options
member.summary: Parameters as for the dotnet call

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNetFDDOptions.Options
member.summary: Parameters as for the dotnet call

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.NewLanguage.ToString
member.summary: Convert the list option to string representation

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.NewLanguage
member.summary: The languages supported by new command

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.NuGetPushOptions
member.summary: nuget push parameters for dotnet nuget push

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Blame
member.summary: Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating the problematic tests causing test host to crash. It creates an output file in the current directory as Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests execution before the crash. (<c>--blame</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.RunSettingsArguments
member.summary: Arguments to pass run settings configurations through commandline. Arguments may be specified as name-value pair of the form <c>[name]=[value]</c> after <c>"-- "</c>. Note the space after <c>--</c>.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.NoRestore
member.summary: Does not do an implicit restore when executing the command. (<c>--no-restore</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Collect
member.summary: Enables data collector for the test run. More info here : https://aka.ms/vstest-collect (<c>--collect</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.ResultsDirectory
member.summary: The directory where the test results are going to be placed. The specified directory will be created if it does not exist. (<c>--results-directory</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.NoBuild
member.summary: Do not build project before testing. (<c>--no-build</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Diag
member.summary: Enable verbose logs for test platform. Logs are written to the provided file. (<c>--diag</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Output
member.summary: Directory in which to find the binaries to be run (<c>--output</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Framework
member.summary: Target framework to publish for. The target framework has to be specified in the project file. (<c>--framework</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration to use for building the project. Default for most projects is "Debug". (<c>--configuration</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Logger
member.summary: Specify a logger for test results. (<c>--logger</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.TestAdapterPath
member.summary: Use custom adapters from the given path in the test run. (<c>--test-adapter-path</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Filter
member.summary: Run tests that match the given expression. (<c>--filter</c>) Examples: <list type="number"> <item> Run tests with priority set to 1: <c>--filter "Priority = 1"</c> </item> <item> Run a test with the specified full name: <c>--filter "FullyQualifiedName=Namespace.ClassName.MethodName"</c> </item> <item> Run tests that contain the specified name: <c>--filter "FullyQualifiedName~Namespace.Class"</c> </item> <item> More info on filtering support: https://aka.ms/vstest-filtering </item> </list>

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.Settings
member.summary: Settings to use when running tests (<c>--settings</c>)

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.TestOptions.WithRedirectOutput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output for the given process is redirected.

member.summary: Changes the "Common" properties according to the given function

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.PublishOptions.Force
member.summary: Force all dependencies to be resolved even if the last restore was successful. This is equivalent to deleting project.assets.json. (<c>--force</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.PublishOptions.NoRestore
member.summary: Doesn't execute an implicit restore when running the command. (<c>--no-restore</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.PublishOptions.SelfContained
member.summary: Publish the .NET Core runtime with your application so the runtime doesn't need to be installed on the target machine. The default is 'true' if a runtime identifier is specified. (<c>--self-contained</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.PublishOptions.Manifest
member.summary: Specifies one or several target manifests to use to trim the set of packages published with the app. The manifest file is part of the output of the dotnet store command. This option is available starting with .NET Core 2.0 SDK. (<c>--manifest</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.PublishOptions.VersionSuffix
member.summary: Defines what <c>*</c> should be replaced with in version field in project.json (<c>--version-suffix</c>)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.Environment
member.summary: Gets the environment variables that apply to this process and its child processes. NOTE: Recommendation is to not use this Field, but instead use the helper function in the Proc module (for example <c>Process.setEnvironmentVariable</c>) NOTE: This field is ignored when UseShellExecute is true.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.PrintRedirectedOutput
member.summary: If RedirectOutput is true this flag decides if FAKE emits the output into the standard output/error otherwise the flag is ignored. True by default.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.RedirectOutput
member.summary: If true the function will redirect the output of the called process (but will disable colors, false by default)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.Timeout
member.summary: Process timeout, kills the process after the specified time

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.Version
member.summary: Write a global.json with the given version (required to make SDK choose the correct version)

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.WithRedirectOutput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the output for the given process is redirected.

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.WithPrintRedirectedOutput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the redirected output should be printed to standard-output/error stream.

member.summary: Changes the "Common" properties according to the given function

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options.Create
member.summary: Create a default setup for executing the dotnet command line. This function tries to take current global.json into account and tries to find the correct installation. To overwrite this behavior set DotNetCliPath manually (for example to the first result of ProcessUtils.findFilesOnPath "dotnet")

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliInstallOptions.DryRun
member.summary: If set it will not perform installation but instead display what command line to use

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliInstallOptions.DebugSymbols
member.summary: Include symbols in the installation (Switch does not work yet. Symbols zip is not being uploaded yet)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliInstallOptions.ForceInstall
member.summary: Always download and run the installer, ignore potentially existing installations.

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliInstallOptions.CustomInstallDir
member.summary: Custom installation directory (for local build installation)

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliInstallOptions.Channel
member.summary:
Specifies the source channel for the installation. The possible values are:
Current - Most current release.
LTS - Long-Term Support channel (most current supported release).
Two-part version in X.Y format representing a specific release (for example, 2.0 or 1.0).
Branch name. For example, release/2.0.0, release/2.0.0-preview2, or master (for nightly releases).
The default value is LTS. For more information on .NET support channels, see the .NET Support Policy page.
member.remarks: Use the CliChannel module, for example CliChannel.Current

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliVersion.GlobalJson
member.summary: Take version from global.json and fail if it is not found.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliVersion.Version
member.summary: Three-part version in X.Y.Z format representing a specific build version; supersedes the -Channel option. For example: 2.0.0-preview2-006120.

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliVersion.Coherent
member.summary: Latest coherent build on the channel; uses the latest stable package combination (used with Branch name -Channel options).

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliVersion.Latest
member.summary: Latest build on the channel (used with the -Channel option).

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliVersion
member.summary: .NET Core SDK version (used to specify version when installing .NET Core SDK)

member.name: T:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.CliArchitecture.Auto
member.summary: this value represents currently running OS architecture

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.InstallerOptions.Branch
member.summary: Download installer from this github branch

member.name: P:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.InstallerOptions.AlwaysDownload
member.summary: Always download install script (otherwise install script is cached in temporary folder)

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.newFromTemplate``1(``0,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.DotNet.NewOptions,Fake.DotNet.DotNet.NewOptions})
member.param: template short name to create from

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.msbuild(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.DotNet.MSBuildOptions,Fake.DotNet.DotNet.MSBuildOptions},System.String)
member.param: A function that overwrites the default MSBuildOptions
A string with the path to the project file to build.

example.code:
open Fake.DotNet let setMsBuildParams (defaults:MSBuild.CliArguments) = { defaults with Verbosity = Some(Quiet) Targets = ["Build"] Properties = [ "Optimize", "True" "DebugSymbols", "True" "Configuration", "Release" ] } let setParams (defaults:DotNet.MSBuildOptions) = { defaults with MSBuildParams = setMsBuildParams defaults.MSBuildParams }
DotNet.msbuild setParams "./MySolution.sln"

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.setupEnv(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options,Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options})
member.summary: Setup the environment (PATH and DOTNET_ROOT) in such a way that started processes use the given dotnet SDK installation. This is useful for example when using fable, see issue #2405
member.param: The SDK to use (result of DotNet.install)

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.prefixProcess``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options,Fake.DotNet.DotNet.Options},Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.String},Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.findPossibleDotnetCliPaths(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String})
member.summary: Get dotnet cli executable path. Probes the provided path first, then as a fallback tries the system PATH
member.param: the path to check else will probe system PATH

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.getSDKVersionFromGlobalJson
member.summary: Gets the DotNet SDK from the global.json. This file can exist in the working directory or any of the parent directories

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.tryGetSDKVersionFromGlobalJson
member.summary: Tries the DotNet SDK from the global.json. This file can exist in the working directory or any of the parent directories Returns None if global.json is not found

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.getSDKVersionFromGlobalJsonDir(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the DotNet SDK from the global.json, starts searching in the given directory.

member.name: M:Fake.DotNet.DotNet.tryGetSDKVersionFromGlobalJsonDir(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to get the DotNet SDK from the global.json, starts searching in the given directory. Returns None if global.json is not found
member.param: The directory to start search from
